document_data.name: Teshendale
document_data.mainbody:
Situated along the valley of the [[River Tesh]], '''Teshendale''' was a lost dale once occupied the rocky territory spanning from [[Zhentil Keep]] to the [[Desertsmouth Mountains]], '''Teshen Valley''' or '''Teshen'''.{{Cite web/theedverse/2023-02-14 - Teshen}} The former dale became a desolate land covered in ruins in the early 14{{th}} century [[DR]].

The [[Dales Council]] continued to keep an empty seat for Teshendale as a reminder of what happened when the Dales do not stick together.
document_data.Inhabitants: Home to a number of [[monstrous humanoid]] and [[goblinoid]] races, the former dale was almost completely overrun with [[goblin]]s, [[orc]]s and [[ogre]]s.

Notable Locations.Settlements:
Although no longer part of the [[Dalelands]], the cities of [[Teshwave]] and [[Snowmantle]] remained under control of Zhentil Keep until their destruction.

*[[Teshwave]]: Once the largest trading community in Teshendale, the city became a staging area for Zhent non-human troops and mercenaries.

*[[Snowmantle]]: Located along the edge of the [[Border Forest]], this settlement became a Zhent logging camp..

document_data.History:
In [[1316 DR]] it was invaded by [[Zhent]] forces and [[orc]]s working for them. The people were slain, enslaved or driven away, and thousands of refugees sought refuge in the surrounding dales.

The valley was quarried and the [[granite]] used to build vast sections of the walls that protected Zhentil Keep.. They continued to strip the land of its resources for over 50 years.

During the late mid 1300's DR, a bandit known as [[Tyran the Outlaw]] struck back against the Zhent forces. Though he had few forces to muster, his efforts had earned himself a 500 [[gp]] bounty.
